talk.author: did:plc:2qsizws3cqz2jdnn5prfs5r6
talk.utter: Interesting, isn’t it? We don’t blame the doctors for acting in their own self interest first and allowing someone else to suffer for their own protection. Because… the law.  Laws may end up in place restricting more and more … at what point will humanity win over the law?

talk.author: did:plc:uu7zo6dzbwpudxplf26ghdx4
talk.utter:
Oh yes, ABSOLUTELY doing your job should routinely involve risking prison time. Anybody would be happy to do that job? Right?

What’s wrong with you?

talk.author: did:plc:2qsizws3cqz2jdnn5prfs5r6
talk.utter: No, it shouldn’t. No. I’m and saying, though, that being unwilling to break a law to save one life will only snowball. This is not about what should and shouldn’t happen in a perfect society.  It’s about… what will you do in ours.  How many rights do we give up without resistance?
